<p>
The graph below shows the whole of a network and how it is interconnected, including the organizations people were involved in. People are rendered in purple, organizations in green. The controls on the left allow you to search for a particular person or organization within the network and/or to select a date (range).
</p>

<p>
Below the nodes the last name of people is given; positioning the cursor over the node displays their full name. The thickness of an edge represents the number of connections between two people. The controls on the left allow you to highlight and/or exclude a specific relationship type.
</p>

<p>
Clicking on a node highlights the individuals directly connected to the selected individual and makes a box appear below the graph showing the number of unique connections as well as a table with all events involving the selected individual. You can only select one individual at a time. You can deselect by clicking in the empty space between the nodes.
</p>

<p>
<strong>
Hover cursor over controls for information on what the controls do
</strong>
</p>
